summary:
Great foreshadow between Ned Catelyn and Sansa and Jon 
Their love is unfortunately great and unbreakable
And finally I realize...
body:
Great foreshadow between Ned Catelyn and Sansa and Jon

Their love is unfortunately great and unbreakable

And finally I realize what Love really means 😭😭😭

I am finally trusting that Jonsa is real 😍😍😍

summary: Game of Thrones Oyuncusu: Dizinin Nasıl Bittiğini Birkaç Arkadaşıma Söyledim
title: Game of Thrones Oyuncusu: Dizinin Nasıl Bittiğini Birkaç Arkadaşıma Söyledim
body:
Game of Thrones Oyuncusu: Dizinin Nasıl Bittiğini Birkaç Arkadaşıma Söyledim

Sansa Stark karakteriyle tanıdığımız Sophie Turner, sır tutmakta iyi olmadığı amacıyla endeksin sonunu birkaç dostuna açıkladığını söyledi.
Günümüzde film ve dizi endüstrisi çok ciddi boyutlara ulaşmış durumda. Bu amaçla üreticilar, on milyonlarca dolar harcayarak oluşturdukları ürünlere dair heyecanın azalmaması amacıyla oyuncular da dahil olmak üzere film ekibindeki şahıslara spoiler vermemeleri…

View On WordPress

summary: Game of Thrones Random Challenge Favourite S6 Moments [2/3] - The Destruction of the Great Sept of Baelor (6.10) I never saw it...
caption:
Game of Thrones Random Challenge

Favourite S6 Moments [2/3] - The Destruction of the Great Sept of Baelor (6.10)

I never saw it coming when I first watched this moment. The use of the music is spot on and it creates a whole suspense, which made me think is Lancel gonna stop the fire and save others? This was the first time that Ramin, who is the composer, use the piano for the score in the scene. It is a huge shock for everyone and the biggest wipeout since the Red Wedding.

title: the kidnapping plot
body:
sansa’s arc started with the lannisters taking her hostage. she was young, naive and very ill prepared to deal with that so she kept her head down and made choices that had the least risk of getting harmed (stannis was going to win so she didn’t leave with the hound. she was going to marry loras so she didn’t leave with littlefinger). sansa knew she had to survive but she didn’t fight back because she didn’t the tools or the confidence to pull it off.

since then sansa has gone to the vale under the control of littlefinger and after nearly getting killed by her aunt, she was taken north and handed over to ramsay whose treatment of her caused her to take more and more risks to escape. she got through to theon past his understandable terror and they escaped together. for the first time in years sansa was in a terrible situation but she wasn’t alone, she had her ‘brother’ theon. if that wasn’t enough they were saved by brienne, a knight like the one in sansa’s stories that she adored as a child. 

sansa went to the wall and pushed for the retaking of winterfell. it wasn’t easy, convincing the northern houses was difficult because they were tired of fighting and because southern style diplomacy would not work on them, a fact sansa noted (look at how she deals with their dissent in s7. she acknowledges their disappointment and the points they were making before carefully refusing their offer of queenship). knowing that they could not win, sansa reached out to littlefinger after realising he felt guilty for marrying her to her rapist. she and jon had disagreements but in the end they won. a short while later sansa became lady of winterfell and she thrived in the role and she finally took down her last abuser. well except for one.

cersei and sansa were intertwined since the first episode. sansa adored cersei and looked up to her but she grew to hate her as the lannisters destroyed her family. cersei saw sansa as pawn, then a girl she both disliked and sympathised with and finally she hated her for killing joffrey. sansa and cersei’s relationship was highlighted in s7 when sansa acknowledged that she learnt a great deal from cersei, the tone of her voice implying that not all of it was good. cersei acknowledged sansa as a political enemy since she was jon’s advisor at that point and her hatred and feelings of betrayal were reaffirmed before she learnt that it was olenna tyrell who killed joffrey.

so now we have a conflict between two people who know, distrust and hate each other and whose opinions of each other are complex and shifting. sansa and cersei are now closer to being equals than any other point in the story. my question is why the fuck is jon being brought into this? he just met cersei at the end of the last season, he doesn’t know her at all, she has had little effect on his arc (the lannister men did more damage to the starks than cersei). when cersei kidnaps sansa, the most natural way for that arc to finally end would be sansa, older wiser braver and more confident, dealing with her past and rescuing herself. jon swooping in does nothing for sansa’s arc or even cersei’s. it just makes everything about him.

i’ve seen people using book sansa’s wish for a true knight to rescue her as justification but book sansa is still in the vale. show sansa has met brienne, has been rescued by theon, has convinced littlefinger to bring the vale knights to the north, has leveraged her position to prepare people for winter to the best of her ability and has killed the man responsible for so much pain and suffering in westeros. show sansa has grown and evolved into a powerful, well written character in her own right. most importantly she has not expressed a wish for someone to take care of her.

simply put sansa doesn’t need jon. in fact jon saving sansa will regress her character development. sansa has been a prisoner thrice, let her take charge when she’s imprisoned for the 4th and last time.

blog.name: fredthealienproductions
blog.title: FREDtheALIEN
blog.description: FRED the ALIEN is the brainchild of one, but raised by many. We are a multi-platform production company, who dabble in videos (YouTube), podcasting (SoundCloud), and the stage. Based in Melbourne's west, we pride ourselves on content that entertains, provokes, critiques, amuses...

title: A Podcast Called FRED #51
body:
A Podcast Called FRED #51

Kendall, Fulya, and Wayne deliver the latest in nerdy news and geeky goodness in the pop culture podcast that refuses to behave—it’s A Podcast Called FRED!

Nerdy News includes:

  • Game of Thrones Season 8 to premiere April 14;
  • Jason Reitman to direct Ghostbusters 3;
  • Anne Hathaway in talks to play the Grand High Witch in Robert Zemeckis’s The Witches remake
  • and more!

Trailer Park discussions:

  • Spid…
